intro: Spermacoce senensis, commonly known as the Brazilian morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its twining stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in moist, shady areas such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
